title: Jim Regan (rugby)
text:
James Regan ( 1939) was a Welsh <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a>, and professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1930s. He played club level rugby union (RU) for <a href="Cardiff%20RFC">Cardiff RFC</a>, as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Hooker">hooker</a>, i.e. number 2, and representative level rugby league (RL) for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a>, and at club level for <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a>, as a , i.e. number 9, during the era of contested <a href="Scrum%20%28rugby%29%23Rugby%20league">scrum</a>s.
International honours.
Jim Regan won a <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a> for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a> (RL) while at Huddersfield in 1939.
